page.title: 07BUILDINGS MUSEUM, BROMSGROVE
page.content: Bromsgrove's{open-air museum}of build- ings, Avoncroft, was begun in the 1960's.It was the first of its kind in Britain and grew out of a desire on the part of a group of people ,led by an architect,Freddie Charles,to save a magnificent {Elizabethan merchant's } {house}(1480) soon to be demolished in the town.The house was removed to a{15 {acre site} piece by numbered piece, timbers repaired, restored to their original beauty, and re-erected, the operation taking volunteers 2 years. Now the museum has{18 old buildings whose {architectural and historical {value}made preservation desirable but whose original sites were required for modern development. Those instrumental in creating this fascinating museum hope visitors will see and value {architectural beauty}in their own environment.
